content.prompt: A well-known fast-food franchise substantially increases the price of its hamburgers, and loses only some of its customers. Which of the following best explains why the franchise has not lost all of its customers

choices.label: Its hamburgers are a perfect substitute for other types of fast food.
The demand for its hamburgers is perfectly elastic.
The other competitive fast-food restaurants decrease the price for their hamburgers.
The barriers to entry are very low for entrepreneurs trying to enter the fast-food business.

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Identify an economic concept, principle, or model illustrated by an example.
